history.content:
You can find the form here: https://ls.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/advlatechangeclassschedule.pdf

And a related EECS 101 post here: @5051

Gist of it is, as long as this is your first semester requesting a late change of schedule before the deadline (which was Dec. 8, before 4pm this semester), your request for late change of schedule is guaranteed. You can make up to 2 requests within the same (first time requesting) semester. Any other request after these will not be reviewed (essentially ignored).

So, for example, suppose I'm taking CS 70 this semester. I can change it to a P/NP or drop it after the regular add/drop or P/NP deadline - as long as it's before the late drop deadline. This change is essentially guaranteed, as long as it's not because you were caught cheating. If you drop below the 13-unit floor, however, it may affect your financial aid, international student status, etc. (see the form for details). You dropping below the 13-unit floor will not affect whether or not the class gets dropped. You can also make a second request within the same semester, but I don't know if this second change is guaranteed (I would assume it isn't). After the semester ends, you cannot make any more requests (I guess you technically could, but they'll all be ignored). 

If you're trying to make a change in your schedule now, it won't be possible, since the deadline was last Friday (12/08), before 4pm.
Where is the link to the new policy about changing PNP past the deadline
history.subject: PNP policy
